news.title: ‘No stone unturned’ to ensure release of Irish charity worker kidnapped from orphanage in Haiti
news.summary: An Irish woman is among nine people who were kidnapped from an orphanage near the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince yesterday.

news.title: Storm Floris: At least 10,000 homes and farms without power as eight counties remain under Status Yellow warnings
news.summary: Ireland is likely to avoid the worst of Storm Floris, with winds expected to peak slightly above 100kmh as the Atlantic storm sweeps across the north-west and towards Scotland.

news.title: ‘We urgently need a transport police to deal with these incidents’ – outrage after child filmed attacking Dublin Bus passenger

news.summary: Relaxing by a Los Angeles hotel rooftop swimming pool sipping spicy margaritas, The Saw Doctors took a moment to reflect on their life.

news.title: Ask Allison: Our sex life is gone after decades of raising children – I want to regain it but she isn’t interested
news.summary: Question:  I have been a married man for 25 years and have four children. Our sex life has diminished over the years due to busy home and work lives.

news.title: Dear Vicki: ‘We have a Coldplay concert situation in our office. What should I do about it?’

news.title: Michael Houghton: ‘When we paid €105k for our first house back in 2013, I was concerned we had overpaid by €5k. It still feels the same every time we purchase a property’
news.summary: Recently, we found ourselves sitting in a quiet pub in a small village on the Loop Head peninsula, chatting to a couple who’d bought a property there 20 years ago.

news.title: Eamonn Sweeney: Dublin ran out deserving winners, but ladies football is in need of its own revolution
news.summary: Ladies football needs its own revolution, its own FRC and its own Jim Gavin. It’s time to pursue integration on as well as off the field.

news.title: Russia and China begin war games in Sea of Japan after Trump nuclear threat
